pageContext.claim: “I went to some of the countries, I said, 'How did it get so imbalanced?' They said, 'Nobody ever called.' They said, 'Nobody ever called.' They'd do whatever they wanted and we'd just put up with it.”
pageContext.analysis: The odds that such conversations took place are slim indeed. U.S. presidents have always demanded better trade agreements with their counterparts; it was a frequent topic of diplomatic discussions. Trump is wrongly focused on trade deficits, as the primary objection would be to expand opportunities to sell U.S. products.
